step: Break Down Fix for Jest/Axios ESM Parsing Error in App.test.js Integration Test Into Sequential Micro-Steps
sub_steps: Check if jest.config.js exists in /reactapp/. If not, create it with basic configuration for transform and transformIgnorePatterns (including axios).
If jest.config.js does exist, add or update 'transformIgnorePatterns' to include '/node_modules/(?!axios)' to ensure that axios is transpiled.
Verify in App.test.js that jest.mock('axios') appears before any import that uses axios (if axios is used in test); if not, add it.
If using fetch instead of axios or if axios is not essential, replace axios API calls in the test with fetch mocks (e.g., using jest-fetch-mock or global.fetch override).
If additional error persists about ESM compatibility in test runs, consider switching axios usage to fetch in the test and mocking with jest-fetch-mock instead of axios.
Make sure to document any new or edited files from this step for tracking.
description: Executes granular, stepwise fixes for the ESM/Babel parsing error with axios in Jest, ensuring Jest properly transforms axios and test files, or falls back to fetch mocking if necessary.

step: Build, Lint, and Test the Front-End React Application
sub_steps: Run npm install in /reactapp/ to install dependencies.
Build the application with npm run build.
Lint code with npx eslint src/ --fix.
Run Jest tests with npm run test:ci and resolve any failures.
description: Verifies integrity of the entire React+Jest UI implementation and ensures all requirements and tests have been met for frontend deliverables.
